member.name: T:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.Exposure.TreatmentMilestone
member.summary:
Things to conisder: 1. Milestones can happen at a daily, weekly, monthly time interval. This must be in relation to the workflow step 2. A rate can be applied, or there is just a significant mark (dosage)
HOW DO YOU MEASURE THE MILESTONE'S TIME IN RELATION TO THE PARENT SEGMENT? WE NEED THIS IN ORDER TO PUT THE RIGHT TIME THAT THE MILESTONE.

member.summary: The interventions that are applied

member.summary: The type of milestone.

member.summary: If dropout or event milestone, the rate to be applied to the treated group.

member.name: T:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.Exposure.TreatmentSegment
member.summary: A treatment segment represents a treatment arm (StudyCell in Schema) which occurs within a period (Epoch in Schema). The treatment segment encapsulates milestones in treatment (intervention changes), dropouts, and events.

member.name: M:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.Exposure.TreatmentSegment.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

members.member:
Performs the process of running through the chain of segments, producing metrics for each significant milestone that occurs.
REMEMBER!!!! THE ORDER OF PROCESSING THE MILESTONES MUST BE IN PROPER SEQUENTIAL ORDER! IF NOT, THE PROCESSING OF THE PATIENT COUNTS WILL BE MESSED UP! r

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.Exposure.TreatmentSegment.Candidate
member.summary: The name of the parent candidate for the schema which the segment rests.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.Exposure.TreatmentSegment.Duration
member.summary: The total duration of the segment. Should coincide with the same time as the period/epoch.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.Exposure.TreatmentSegment.Milestones
member.summary: A collection of milestones that occur during the duration of the segment.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.Exposure.TreatmentSegment.Paths
member.summary: The set of next treatment segments this segment distributes patients to. The key is the next segment while the value is the randomization ratio.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.NonEnrollingSiteCount
member.summary: these are the total sites that did not or could not enroll

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.PredictedZeroEnrollingSiteCount
member.summary: these are the total sites that could not enroll because worst case or performance data yields zero patients

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.FirstSite
member.summary: Gets or sets the first site.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.PatientCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the patient count.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.LastMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the last month.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.PredictedCost
member.summary: Gets/Sets the predicted cost.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.MimimumExceedsPotential
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mimimum exceeds the potential count.
member.value: true if the mimimum exceeds the potential count; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.IsMaxedOut
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is maxed out.
member.value: true if this instance is maxed out; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.AcceptableSiteCount
member.summary: Count of sites that are used by less than 2 trials

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.UnacceptableSiteCount
member.summary: Used in CP only Count of sites that are used by more than 2 trials

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.UnassignedSiteCount
member.summary: This is used in CP only Count of sites that are not assigned to any trials

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.SiteMetricTotals.RegionName
member.summary: Region where this site metric belongs.

member.name: T:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod
member.summary: Represents a treatment period for a RandomizedArm

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.ParentArm
member.summary: The parent of the period.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.Ordinal
member.summary: The position of the period.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.Length
member.summary: The length of time of the period in months.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.Interventions
member.summary: List of interventions applied to the period

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.ExposedToDrug
member.summary: Flags if the period is exposed to a treatment/investigational drug or any other type of intervention.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.InitialPath
member.summary: Flags if the period is part of the initial path. A period is in the initial path if the period lies within the continuous set of periods starting from period one.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.IsCombined
member.summary: Flag if a treatment period is a combination of a series of continuous treatment periods.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.CombinedPeriods
member.summary: Gets the list of periods this period combines

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.NextPeriod
member.summary: Points to the next period in it's path.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.DropoutRate
member.summary: Sets the dropout rate that occurs during this treatment period.

member.name: P:Semio.ClientService.Intelligence.TreatmentPeriod.IsContinous
member.summary: Returns true if the next period shares the same arm. What is also important in the idea of continuity is that the same intervention must be shared across to the next period. This way if we have (eg.) two 6 month periods we can stitch the periods together to give a more accurate 12 month period representation.
